title: The Patchwork City
outcome: Stenograd splinters into value-based enclaves as districts refuse to return to former norms, each running their own BCI rules. Council power collapses as citizens embrace their differences, celebrating newfound self-determination. A truth about Halden's death emerges: he designed the system for local autonomy, not uniform control.

events.description: Major districts openly reject returning to the pre-Exchange system, declaring unique civic values and adjusting local BCI rules to match their priorities.
Daily life becomes unpredictable as services, privileges, and restrictions shift by neighborhood. Lintz launches emergency protocols to let residents move and adapt across district lines.
Council convenes a fractious session; Directorate demands BCI reset, Harmonists propose mediation. Innovators reveal Halden’s archived memo: 'Control was never the goal. Let them choose.'
With Council gridlocked, districts host a citywide 'Festival of Differences.' Diverse communities share art, food, and open debates, symbolizing a new patchwork order across Stenograd.
Council formally dissolves itself, citing Halden’s vision. The BCI is reduced to a voluntary local tool, and Stenograd’s districts begin negotiating new forms of mutual recognition.
